clues.text: Underage drinkers in the northeast fear getting "proofed"; elsewhere, they fear they'll be this
A hurricane is a tropical one
"Body" of work for an M.E.
To bend or fold sheet metal edges together
9-letter term for an agreement between a sovereign state & the Pope

rounds.comments: (Alex: Now since all three of you are Democrats, we thought you would appreciate our first category, which is...)

clues.text: In 1954 he became the first & only U.S. senator elected by a write-in vote; he's still there
In 1996 this Mississippian succeeded Bob Dole as Senate majority leader
This California governor has defeated 2 Democratic women, Dianne Feinstein & Kathleen Brown
Chairman of the House Ways & Means Committee, he succeeded George Bush in Texas' 7th District
In the 1993 film "Born Yesterday", this future U.S. senator played a U.S. senator
This world record-holding sprinter is the star of the video "The Flo-Jo Workout"
In May 1954 it took Roger Bannister 3 minutes 59.4 seconds to cover this distance
He won 5 Olympic golds in running events not to mention 4 consecutive long jump medals
Now an Anaheim Angel, this outfielder has led the American League in steals for 11 seasons
On Oct. 31, 1996 this race horse retired after "smoking" the tracks with 19 wins
In this state you can Kissimmee once, twice & once again, as it's a river, lake & city
At its north end, the Dead Sea receives this river
The James, Potomac & Chester Rivers all flow into this bay
It's still working on deepening the Grand Canyon
The river known as the "Great Man-Made River" in Libya reaches into this desert

rounds.comments: (Alex: You did so well with Republicans in the first round; how are you going to do with this category...)

clues.text: South Carolina senator Ernest F. Hollings shares this nickname with fellow Democrat Walter Mondale
This Ohioan is flying high as the ranking Democrat on the Senate Governmental Affairs Committee
This West Virginian has served in the U.S. Senate longer than any current Democrat -- 38 years
This Nebraskan is vice chairman of the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence
In 1994 this incumbent Florida governor narrowly beat GOP challenger Jeb Bush
In this Andrew Lloyd Webber musical, an actress becomes the most powerful woman in Argentina
Sophocles wrote 2 plays about this title king who "wrecks" his life by marrying his mother

This classic musical about a 19th C. ruler returned to Broadway in 1996; it features the following:
("Shall We Dance")
A famous D.C. address, it was the title of a 1976 musical; Lerner felt low when it flopped
As a character in "Annie", this president sings "A New Deal for Christmas" with Daddy Warbucks
The shore of this island is indented by numerous bays including Donegal Bay & Belfast Lough
Over 700,000 square miles, or about 84%, of this island is covered by an icecap
The largest & most westernmost island in the West Indies, it's the world's largest sugar exporter
In 1891 the first fossils of Homo erectus were discovered on this Indonesian island
L'Anse aux Meadows on this eastern Canadian island is the first authenticated Viking site in North America
On Dec. 11, 1996 this country agreed to search its banks for the assets of Holocaust victims
A German court convicted her father of failing to pay taxes of $7.4 million on tennis earnings
Philippe Bourguignon left the chairmanship of Eurodisney to join this resort "club"
In 1997 Tony Blair's new government gave this bank control of interest rates
In July 1996 a war crimes warrant was issued for this political leader of Bosnia's Serbs
Tarte makes a dual-ended lip gloss named for this romantic pair, swingin' in the jungle since 1912
Sephora.com describes its "Sexy Jungle" lipstick as a "cool toffee shade of" this
Type of African trip whose name precedes "Blaze" in the name of a Laura Geller lipstick
Iman named one of her company's lipstick shades for this wildcat that's also a luxury car
Sultry, Hot & Passionate (Excuse me--I need to cool down) are just 3 of the shades in this co.'s Lipfinity line
Words meaning "equitable" & "direction" combine for this part of a golf course
Part of an envelope meets something to raise your car, putting this word on the breakfast menu
Take a brief interval of time, put it before a pointer on a clock & you get this preowned word
You can deceive someone by doing this, made from a part of some sweatshirts plus closing an eye
Words meaning "to catch a fish" & "to grade a paper" combine to make this type of important site
Wild West fun abounds during Cheyenne Frontier Days in this state
8 presidential eyes gaze down on the National Presidential Wax Museum-- it's 2 miles from this attraction
Log on to your computer to learn that Knott's Berry Farm claims to have the very first one of these "log" rides
Visit the automobile museum at this famous home to see the red MG Elvis drove in "Blue Hawaii"
Feel like a female deity when you eat this "verdant" salad dressing at S.F.'s Palace Hotel (it was invented there)
No script overlap here: Barry O'Brien both wrote for "CSI: Miami" & co-created this Miley Cyrus phenomenon
"A Benihana Christmas" by Jennifer Celotta had this comedy's Michael Scott canceling the holiday itself
The truth is out there: Ken Biller co-wrote "Eve", an episode of this Fox drama from which the band Eve 6 got its name
Carol Barbee co-wrote the "Why We Fight" episode of this CBS show which fought its own cancellation (at least briefly)
Before writing for "AFV" & "Freaks and Geeks", J. Elvis Weinstein was the original voice of Tom Servo on this cult classic

rounds.text: In "Godspell" this character leads the company in singing, "Prepare Ye The Way Of The Lord"
